alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 03 at 7:08PM EST until March 04 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 10 AM EST Saturday. For the Wind Advisory, from 10 AM to 1 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
